general.create:
Create a new file in the current directory:
Example: create 'filename.txt'

Current Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
Command: create 'hardware.txt'

Updated Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt ****
general.delete:
Delete an existing file from the current directory:
Example: delete 'filename.txt'

Current Directory:
	**** hardware.txt ****
	**** persons.txt ****
Command: delete 'hardware.txt'

Updated Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
general.rename:
Rename a file in the current directory:
Example: rename 'oldFileName' 'newFileName'

Current Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt ****
Command: rename 'hardware.txt' 'mikes_hardware.txt'

Updated Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** mikes_hardware.txt ****
general.modify:
Modify the permissions of a file:
- Command: modify 'filename.txt' '<permission>'
- Permissions: <read> or <write>

Current Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt ****

Example Command:
	modify 'hardware.txt' 'write'

Updated Directory (permissions updated):
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt **** (write permission granted)
general.list:
List the attributes of files in the current directory:
- Command: list

Current Directory:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt ****

Example Command:
	list

Output:
	**** persons.txt ****
	**** hardware.txt ****
general.change:
Change to a different directory:
Example: cd 'directory_name'

Current Directory:
	**** /home/user ****
Command: cd 'Documents'

Updated Directory:
	**** /home/user/Documents ****
general.make:
Create a new directory:
Example: mkdir 'directory_name'

Current Directory:
	**** /home/user ****
Command: mkdir 'Projects'

Updated Directory:
	**** /home/user/Projects created ****
general.remove:
Remove an existing directory:
Example: rmdir 'directory_name'

Current Directory:
	**** /home/user ****
Command: rmdir 'Projects'

Updated Directory:
	**** /home/user/Projects removed ****
general.pwd:
Display the current directory:
Command: pwd

Example Output:
	Current Directory:
	**** /home/user ****

info.create: Use this command to create a new file named <file_name>
info.delete: Use this command to remove a file named <file_name>
info.rename: Use this command to change the name of a file from <file_name> to <new_file_name>
info.modify: Use this command to change the permissions of a file, specifying <read> or <write>
info.list: Use this command to view the attributes of all files in your current directory
info.change: Use this command to change the current directory
info.make: Use this command to create a new directory named <directory_name>
info.remove: Use this command to remove a directory named <directory_name>
info.pwd: Use this command to display the current directory
